Translation: There lived a wife and a husband
There lived a man with his wife
we two; the two of us

Primary_Text: boštə šü tʼogən, kugojdə dü tʼogən
Gloss: self-POSS.3SG DEM.DIST place-LOC earring-POSS.3SG DEM.PROX place-LOC
Translation: His/her body is in that world, his/her earring is in this world
the reindeer of the two of us
Let's the two of us fingerwrestle!
On a mountain a cauldron is boiling

Primary_Text: i döbǝr amnoźittǝ šobiiʔ, kamǝn šĭšǝge molāmbi

Translation: And they came here to live when it had become cold
She jumped and clinged to the boy (lit. jumping she clatched)
After he has come home he tells his mother
S/he came while I was eating

Primary_Text: kömǝ poʔdǝ iʔböne ťogǝn noʔ ej özerie

Primary_Text: Dĭ mĭnzərbi bar, amorbi. Nünniet bar: šĭndidə šonəga
Analyzed: dĭ mĭnzə-r-bi bar amor-bi nün-nie-t bar šĭndi-də šo-nə-ga
